q1: Qual Ã¨ la differenza tra KB e KiB?
a1: KB (kilobyte) usa base 1000 (1 KB = 1000 byte). KiB (kibibyte) usa base 1024 (1 KiB = 1024 byte). I computer usano solitamente base 1024.
a2: Per storage (dischi, USB) usa base 1000. Per memoria RAM e dimensioni file usa base 1024.
a3: Base 1000: 1 TB = 1000 GB. Base 1024: 1 TiB = 1024 GiB.
a4: Bytes, KB, MB, GB, TB, PB, Kilobits, Megabits, and Gigabits.
a5: Yes, using precise binary conversion factors.
